titles: Whereas we are informed, that in many cities and towns corporate within this kingdom, greater customers, tolls and duties than are really due, have been of late exacted in right of the said corporations, upon goods imported or exportd into or out of the said cities and towns corporate, to the great prejudice of His Majestie his customers, the decay of trade, and the discouragement of merchants ... by the Lord Lieutenant and Council, Essex.
author: Ireland. Lord Lieutenant (1672-1677 : Essex)
Essex, Arthur Capel, Earl of, 1631-1683.
publisher: Printed by Benjamin Took ... and are to be sold by Joseph Wilde ...,
notes: Title from first 10 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council-chamber in Dublin the 25th day of October. 1672"--leaf [2]
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
keywords: Customs administration --  Ireland --  Officials and employees.
